item.title: $1 trillion on the table in debt talks
item.description: lawmakers are weighing $1 trillion in deficit-cutting measures as part of a possible deal that would allow an increase in the country's borrowing authority, vice president joe biden said on tuesday.

item.title: crisis-hit saab finds funds, hopes to start output
item.description: ailing car maker saab has lined up almost 60 million euros ($88.9 million) in funds to get production started again after a month of stoppage, its dutch owner spyker said on monday.

item.title: republicans suggest deal possible on healthcare
item.description: top congressional republicans said on sunday they would be open to a compromise on healthcare costs, one of the biggest stumbling blocks in a deal to get the united states' debt under control.

item.description: an elderly man who tested positive for salmonella has died, according to rhode island officials investigating an outbreak of salmonella that has sickened 39 people.

item.description: wall street ended a four-day rally with its worst session since august on wednesday and could suffer more losses in coming days as investors faced more signs the economic recovery is fading.
